text_1.title: Veridan
text_1.content:
Deep within the lush, uncharted jungles of South America lies the legend of the Lost City of Veridan, a mysterious metropolis rumored to have been built with technology so advanced it could harness the power of the sun. The city, according to fragmented ancient manuscripts and indigenous lore, was constructed by a civilization known as the Solarians, who were both revered and feared for their mystical abilities and technological prowess.
Veridan, often described in these ancient texts, was strategically positioned in a valley surrounded by dense forest and steep cliffs, making it nearly invisible from the outside. The Solarians engineered a series of large crystal arrays, which they used to collect and amplify solar energy. These arrays powered everything in the city, from their homes to intricate systems of water purification and agricultural facilities, enabling them to thrive in isolation.
The architecture of Veridan was a testament to the Solarian’s understanding of both engineering and aesthetics. Buildings were made of a luminous material that reflected the jungle’s greenery, camouflaging the city during the day. At night, the crystals embedded in the structures would glow softly, illuminating the city with a gentle light that mimicked the starry sky above.
Central to the city was the Grand Solar Temple, a magnificent structure located at the heart of Veridan. Here, the Solarians worshiped the sun, which they believed was the source of all life and knowledge. The temple housed the Great Crystal, the core of their solar harnessing technology. It was said that during the equinox, the alignment of the sun with the Great Crystal would unlock potent energies, bringing prosperity and harmony to the Solarian people.
Despite its rumored wonders, the location of Veridan has eluded explorers and historians for centuries. Many have speculated that the city's eventual downfall was linked to a catastrophic event that either destroyed or buried Veridan under layers of earth and vegetation, concealing its secrets from the world.
Legends suggest that the Solarians might have foreseen their demise. In a bid to protect their knowledge, they created elaborate puzzles and traps around the city. These not only served to deter greedy treasure hunters but were also a test, designed to ensure that only those wise and pure of heart could rediscover and perhaps resurrect the Solarian’s advanced technologies.
Today, the myth of Veridan inspires countless adventurers, historians, and scientists. Some seek the city for its treasures, while others hope to learn the secrets of the Solarians’ advanced use of renewable energy, which could revolutionize modern technology. Yet, the jungle keeps its secrets well, and the Lost City of Veridan remains a symbol of human ingenuity and a reminder of the mysteries that our world still holds.

questions.question: What's the author's purpose in writing the text?
options: To show the readers that the Solarians were not greedy and pure of heart.
To show the readers that the Sun was the source of all life and knowledge
To tell the readers of the ancient city that is buried deep within the uncharted jungles of South Africa.
To give the readers a brief overview of the Lost City of Veridan.
questions.correct_answer: To give the readers a brief overview of the Lost City of Veridan.

questions.question: What is the text mainly about?
options: Various stories and legends in South America.
The development of technology in South America.
The power of the Sun in South America.
An interesting civilization in South America.
questions.correct_answer: An interesting civilization in South America.

questions.question: What kind of people may be most interested in the Lost City of Veridan?
options: Those who would like to live in the jungle.
Those who seek the answers to ancient puzzles.
Anyone interested in astrology.
Those interested in solar energy.
questions.correct_answer: Those interested in solar energy.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Veridan's architecture?
options: Unconcerned and imaginative.
Dark and sophisticated.
Humorous and inspiring.
Innovative and magnificent .
questions.correct_answer: Innovative and magnificent.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true according to the passage?
options: It is believed that the city's destruction was linked to a catastrophe.
The city was designed by the Solarians.
It is rumored that the Solarians built the city in a valley of dense forest and steep cliffs.
Only a select few ever found Veridan.
questions.correct_answer: Only a select few ever found Veridan.

text_2.title: Eternal Night
text_2.content:
In the far reaches of the cosmos, within the constellation of Orion, lies a celestial enigma known as the Nebula of Eternal Night. This nebula is home to a unique astronomical phenomenon: the fading stars. Unlike any other in the galaxy, these stars exhibit a mysterious pattern of luminosity, emitting bright light that abruptly dims, as if swallowed by the darkness of space.
The Nebula of Eternal Night is primarily observed through the lenses of powerful space telescopes equipped with ultra-sensitive detectors capable of capturing the faintest glimmers of light. The fading stars within this nebula periodically shed their outer layers, revealing their radiant cores. This process creates a spectacular but ephemeral glow that fades almost as soon as it is detected. The regularity and brevity of these luminous episodes have baffled astronomers, suggesting an unknown mechanism at work.
These stars are not just astronomical curiosities; they are crucial to understanding the life cycles of celestial bodies. The phenomenon observed in the Nebula of Eternal Night challenges existing theories about stellar behavior and lifecycle. Typically, a star losing its outer layers is in the final stages of life, heading towards collapse or transformation into a denser state like a white dwarf or neutron star. However, the stars in this nebula seem to regenerate their lost mass, undergoing a rebirth that defies the conventional understanding of astrophysics.
The environment of the Nebula of Eternal Night is equally peculiar. The nebula is composed of an unusually dense concentration of dark matter and exotic gases, which might play a role in the unique behavior of its stars. Some astrophysicists propose that these gases could be interacting with the stars’ magnetic fields, triggering the cyclic shedding and regeneration of stellar material.
Studying this nebula not only provides insights into the dynamics of star formation and death but also offers a window into the effects of dark matter on visible matter. The Nebula of Eternal Night serves as a natural laboratory for testing theories of cosmic evolution and the interplay between light and darkness in the universe.
In addition to scientific interest, the Nebula of Eternal Night has captured the imagination of science fiction writers and enthusiasts. Its mysterious, intermittent light pulses serve as a beacon in narratives about interstellar navigation and cosmic phenomena. The nebula’s allure lies in its mystery and the promise of uncovering cosmic secrets that could redefine our understanding of the universe.

questions.question: The Nebula of Eternal Night is unique in its _
options: constiuent planets
dark atmosphere
magnetic fields
luminous pattern
questions.correct_answer: luminous pattern

questions.question: The fading stars are peculiar because their luminosity _.
options: is not strong
depends on their density
is regulated by the darkness of space
differs from that of other stars
questions.correct_answer: differs from that of other stars

questions.question: The Nebula of Eternal Night appears to be _.
options: a central nebula to all the stars
a nebula formed by white dwarfs
a nebula containing many strange galaxies
a nebula in the constellation of Orion
questions.correct_answer: a nebula in the constellation of Orion

questions.question: According to the passage,the fading stars within the Nebula appear to be _.
options: developing an interesting life cycle
falling into the darkness of space
disappearing altogether
resetting their lost mass
questions.correct_answer: resetting their lost mass

questions.question: What can possibly cause the fading stars?
options: Dark matter and radiation
Bright light and dark space
Radiant cores and magnetic fields
Dark matter and exotic gases
questions.correct_answer: Dark matter and exotic gases

text_3.title: Zoo Escape
text_3.content:
It was a normal morning at the Crestwood Zoo. Families arrived early to watch the zookeepers feed the animals, and children eagerly gathered for the daily elephant parade. But as the day warmed, a sense of unease spread among the staff. Several enclosures were unusually quiet, and the security team noticed that the main gate was ajar.

The zookeepers quickly discovered that a pair of curious monkeys, a zebra, a red panda, and even a giraffe were missing from their enclosures. The zoo staff sprang into action, closing public areas and alerting the local authorities. Visitors were escorted out for their safety as the search began.

Police and zookeepers fanned out to search the surrounding neighborhoods. Reports of unusual sightings began to come in. Joggers claimed to have seen the zebra trotting through a nearby park. A startled commuter reported a monkey peering through her car window at a traffic light. The giraffe was spotted grazing on a tall tree near the zoo's perimeter.

The zoo director, Mr. Thompson, coordinated the search effort with the police. He knew that capturing the escaped animals without causing harm was critical. The team of experienced handlers used tranquilizer darts and nets to catch the animals safely.

The first capture was the red panda, found in a residential backyard, hiding in a tree. Using a ladder, the zookeepers managed to retrieve the animal and return it to the zoo. The monkeys proved trickier, darting between rooftops and swinging from trees. It took a few hours to finally corner them in a playground, lured down with bananas.

The zebra caused quite a commotion near a local school. With the help of the police, the zookeepers guided it into a transport trailer and returned it to its enclosure. The giraffe, though gentle, required more finesse to capture. Using a crane and a large net, the team gently guided it back into the zoo.

By the end of the day, all the escaped animals had been safely returned to their enclosures. The zoo reopened to the public with heightened security measures. The incident became the talk of the city, with many people praising the zookeepers for their swift and compassionate response. As for the animals, they seemed content to be back in their familiar surroundings after their brief adventure.

questions.question: The purpose of the passage is to _
options: show the zookeepers are skilled at handling dangerous animals
advise people not to enter a zoo near residential area
explain a wildlife incident
report a series of rescue efforts
questions.correct_answer: report a series of rescue efforts

questions.question: What is the best title of the passage?
options: The Action of the Zoo
What to Do for Lost Animals
A New Zoo in Crestwood
Finding Lost Animals
questions.correct_answer: Finding Lost Animals

questions.question: What did the zoo director do to catch the animals?
options: He called for the public's help.
He used a crane and a net to catch them.
He searched the surrounding neighborhoods.
He coordinated with the police.
questions.correct_answer: He coordinated with the police.

questions.question: What's the author's attitude towards the incident?
options: Disappointed.
Doubtful.
Negative.
Objective.
questions.correct_answer: Objective.

questions.question: How did the zookeepers catch the monkeys?
options: By using a crane and a net.
By calling the police
By using tranquilizer darts.
By luring them into the playground.
questions.correct_answer: By luring them into the playground.

text_4.title: Echos
text_4.content: In the serene town of Greywood, nestled between foggy hills and ancient woods, there was a small library that seemed to whisper tales of old to anyone who passed its creaky doors. The librarian, Mrs. Hazel, was an elderly woman with a kind smile, known for her deep love of books and the stories they held. She had a peculiar habit of talking to the books as if they were her friends. One rainy evening, just as the last rays of the sun disappeared behind the clouds, a boy named Theo stumbled into the library. He was a shy, bookish child, often lost in his thoughts and always in search of new adventures through the pages of books. 'Theo, my dear boy, what brings you here so late?' Mrs. Hazel asked, peering over her glasses. 'I was hoping to find a book, a special book that I've heard whispers about in school. They say it's a book that can change with every reader,' Theo replied, his eyes wide with curiosity. 'Ah, you must be speaking of 'The Book of Echoes,' said Mrs. Hazel, a glint of excitement in her eyes. 'It's a very ancient and magical book. Let me see if I can find it for you.' As Mrs. Hazel shuffled through the dusty shelves, Theo wondered about the stories that awaited him. After a few moments, she returned with an old, leather-bound book. Its cover was plain, but as Theo touched it, the title shimmered into view, reflecting his own name: 'Theo's Journey.""This book,' Mrs. Hazel began, 'will show you not just any story, but your story. Go on, open it.' Theo opened the book, and to his amazement, the pages began to fill with words, forming a story about a young boy who discovered a hidden world beneath his town. The more he read, the more the story seemed to mirror his own dreams and fears, weaving them into a fantastic adventure. As the clock struck midnight, something extraordinary happened. The characters in the book seemed to lift off the pages, their voices echoing around the room. Theo listened, enraptured by the tale that unfolded, a tale that spoke of courage, friendship, and the magic hidden in everyday life. The story told of the boy’s quest to save this hidden world from a shadowy menace, a journey that taught him about bravery and the importance of standing up for what is right. Each chapter challenged Theo to think about his own life, about the decisions he would make, and the kind of person he wanted to be. Hours passed like minutes, and as Theo reached the last page, he felt as if he had lived a lifetime in one night. The final words of the book resonated deeply with him: 'Every story has its echoes in the world. Listen closely, and you will hear them in your heart.' Theo looked up at Mrs. Hazel, who was smiling knowingly. 'Every reader brings something of themselves to 'The Book of Echoes,' and in return, it gives them a piece of its wisdom.' As dawn broke over Greywood, Theo left the library with a new sense of understanding and purpose. He knew that the magic of the book was not just in its words, but in how it reflected and transformed the reader’s own thoughts and feelings. And so, in a small library in a fog-covered town, a young boy discovered that within him lay not just the capacity for great adventures, but also the power to change his own story.

questions.question: What is the best title of the passage?
options: An old woman
A boy's quest for treasure
A magic book
An interesting story
questions.correct_answer: A magic book

questions.question: What's the main idea of this passage?
options: The librarian's strange habit.
A book that changed a young boy's life.
A wonderful book about a magical town.
A book that helped a young boy overcome his shyness.
questions.correct_answer: A book that changed a young boy's life.

questions.question: What is the author's purpose of writing the passage?
options: To describe the magic of Theo's journey.
To encourage readers to read more.
To suggest a library was abandoned in the town.
To introduce Theo to readers.
questions.correct_answer: To encourage readers to read more.

questions.question: What was Theo's attitude towards the book?
options: He was entertained by it
He was intrigued by it.
He was annoyed by it.
He was indifferent to it.
questions.correct_answer: He was intrigued by it.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE according to the passage?
options: Theo was a shy and foolish boy.
Theo was a shy, bookish boy who loved books.
Theo was a very smart kid.
Theo often wandered in the library to find new adventures.
questions.correct_answer: Theo was a shy, bookish boy who loved books.

text_5.title: Kelandra
text_5.content:
In the 12th century, the hidden city of Kelandra thrived deep within the Kaldian Mountains. Only a select few knew of its existence. Kelandra was founded by exiled scholars who rejected the corrupt practices of the ruling empire. They envisioned a utopia where knowledge and integrity were valued above all else.
The city was constructed within a vast cavern, its walls aglow with bioluminescent fungi. This gentle light illuminated Kelandra year-round. A great stone bridge spanned the river running through the city, leading to the central square where the grand Library of Knowledge stood. The library contained scrolls, books, and artifacts from across the known world, serving as the city's intellectual hub.
Kelandra's residents were dedicated to preserving ancient arts and sciences, sharing their knowledge with those beyond the city. They formed secret networks with like-minded individuals in neighboring kingdoms, sending emissaries to exchange information and build alliances. This helped Kelandra remain hidden while exerting subtle influence on the outside world.
One of Kelandra's most respected figures was Master Aleric, an expert in ancient languages and cryptography. Aleric spent years deciphering long-forgotten scripts, gaining insights into lost civilizations and prophecies predicting the rise and fall of empires.
Despite Kelandra's secrecy, whispers of its existence began to spread. A rogue merchant named Gaius claimed to have visited the city and described its wonders to anyone who would listen. These tales drew the attention of the ruling empire, which sought to control all sources of power and knowledge.
Emperor Calyrian, known for his ruthless tactics, ordered his agents to capture Gaius to extract the location of Kelandra from him. The emperor's spies scoured the land, finding fragments of messages exchanged between Kelandra's emissaries and their contacts, piecing together clues that hinted at the city's general location.
As the empire's forces closed in, Kelandra's leaders faced a tough decision: abandon the city to preserve its secrecy, or defend it against the oncoming threat? After days of debate, the council of scholars chose to stand their ground, believing the knowledge they protected was worth the risk.
The citizens of Kelandra prepared for battle, fortifying their defenses and hiding their most valuable artifacts within secret chambers. As the empire's armies approached the Kaldian Mountains, Kelandra's fate hung in the balance, its legacy a testament to the enduring power of knowledge and the struggle to preserve it.

questions.question: The author tries to tell us that Kelandra was founded by _.
options: masters
a noble family
the emperor
exiled scholars
questions.correct_answer: exiled scholars

questions.question: What can we infer from the passage?
options: A rogue merchant named Gaius visited Kelandra to share knowledge with others.
Emperor Calyrian was not a good ruler at all.
The inhabitants of Kelandra kept their secret for more than 100 years.
The residents of Kelandra valued their knowledge very highly.
questions.correct_answer: The residents of Kelandra valued their knowledge very highly.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is NOT true according to the passage?
options: The city was built in a cave.
A great stone bridge ran across the river.
Master Aleric was one of Kelandra's most respected figures.
The citizens of Kelandra were able to survive the attack of the empire's armies.
questions.correct_answer: The citizens of Kelandra were able to survive the attack of the empire's armies.

questions.question: According to the passage, the city of Kelandra _
options: is believed to be the birthplace of a great civilization
has been abandoned by the empire
was built on a river bed
is a city where ancient arts and sciences were protected.
questions.correct_answer: is a city where ancient arts and sciences were protected.

questions.question: The citizens of Kelandra _ in the 12th century.
options: lived in a peaceful city
were ruled by the ruling empire
built a great library for the whole kingdom
kept their secrets from others
questions.correct_answer: kept their secrets from others
